author: vorot93
content:
There is a reason why Erigon discord is invite-only ğŸ™‚

Maybe makes sense for this Discord as well

author: butta
content: Or just add a verification bot ğŸ˜…  Happy to help

author: sky.cactus
content: Ugh.  Verification bots have a tendency to foil regular users more than bots in my experience.

author: sky.cactus
content: The only type of bot that they stop are incredibly generic scripts you can download online that don't have handlers built for them that defeats the verification bot.

author: sky.cactus
content: And even then, it only works if you segregate users, which becomes a bit of a management nightmare in a server this large since *every* channel created must have either verified users allowed into it or non-verified users allowed to it but **never** both (otherwise the verification bot doesn't do anything about DM spam, which is a bigger problem in my experience.

author: schone_wizard
content: excuse me for being out of the loop here, but is Erigon ready for prime time? and is Erigon what started as Turbo-Geth?

author: schone_wizard
content: is it good as a drop in replacement for geth in a live mainnet validator setup?

author: timbeiko
content: It is a rename of TurboGeth, and it syncs to mainnet, but I'm not sure if it has all the required features to replace geth when running alongside an eth2 validator

author: yorickdowne
content: See how I said "on the DL"? Erigon takes that to an extreme. Zero, nada, zilch in release notes, and this on start: `Initialised chain configuration          config="{ChainID: 1 Homestead: 1150000 DAO: 1920000 DAOSupport: true EIP150: 2463000 EIP155: 2675000 EIP158: 2675000 Byzantium: 4370000 Constantinople: 7280000 Petersburg: 7280000 Istanbul: 9069000, Muir Glacier: 9200000, Berlin: 12244000, London: 12965000, Engine: ethash}"`

author: timbeiko
content: Oh, intersting! Thanks for sharing ğŸ™‚

author: yorickdowne
content: Alpha releases. **Not** ready for production IMO. My opinion is technically quite conservative. There is room for differing opinions, for sure.

author: yorickdowne
content: And yes, Erigon was once named "Turbo-Geth"

author: yorickdowne
content: A month ago? More? In Ethereum time, does that equal "years"? ğŸ¤£
